intro: Sium segetum, commonly known as water parsnip, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as along the edges of ponds and streams. Its root system is fibrous and can be harvested for its aromatic, edible roots. Sium segetum plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and wildlife.
